Function.Description: The fact function determines the factorial of the value specified in the argument {num}.

Brief.Overview: The fact function determines the factorial of the value specified in the argument {num}. The factorial of a number is the product of multiplying integers from 1 up to (and including) the specified number. The mathematical formula for factorials is represented as N!=1 * 2 * 3...*N.
Brief.Usage: The fact function is used to compute the factorial of a number.

Syntax.Return: The computed factorial. Always in Integer form.
